description: I am using this for some time. It is a little bit similar to KDE activity feature in my opinion. I have setup few workspaces like gaming+recording, online school etc.
summary: Great little tool to speed up work

description: I use this app for projects in which I use several apps and files in parallel. However, I miss being able to easily specify actions like open a specific file with the default app.

I quite like this little tool but it would be nice if you could open workspaces in specific - well, workspaces within the Gnome desktop environment. You can already do this with a little bit of fiddling around with custom commands but it should be a built in option. 

Also, while this is probably the fault of the apps themselves, not all apps seem to realize that they have already been initialized. Emacs for instance strangely both launches another instance of itself AND switches to the one that was already launched. Not sure what that's about but despite these niggles, it is still more than a worthwhile addition to your productivity toolkit.
summary: Quite useful but with some annoying limitations
